subject: p12530259
History: Patient with left lower lobe lobectomy.
Findings: ET tube ends 45 cm above carina. NG tube is in the stomach, and left jugular line ends in upper SVC. There is no pneumothorax, and left chest tube is in unchanged position in upper hemithorax. Left upper lobe that was collapsed yesterday is more aerated and left lung pulmonary edema has significantly improved. There is some residual small basilar atelectasis and small pleural effusion, if any. Mild subcutaneous air has improved. Right lung is unremarkable. Mediastinal and cardiac contours are unchanged.
Impression: Patient with recent left lower lobe lobectomy. Aeration and edema of remaining left upper lung has improved.
